properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from High Island to Freeport TX out 20 NM; Coastal waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX out 20 NM; Waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX from 20 to 60 NM; Waters from High Island to Freeport TX from 20 to 60 NM
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued January 11 at 2:41AM CST until January 11 at 3:15AM CST by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
properties.description:
For the following areas...
Coastal waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX out 20
NM...
Coastal waters from High Island to Freeport TX out 20 NM...
Waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX from 20 to 60 NM...
Waters from High Island to Freeport TX from 20 to 60 NM...

At 240 AM CST, strong thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 19 nm west of Port Arthur to 34 nm southwest of East
Breaks 228, moving southeast at 25 knots.

HAZARD...Wind gusts to 40 knots.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Small craft could be damaged in briefly higher winds and
suddenly higher waves.

Locations impacted include...
Galveston A8, Galveston A122, Tabs Buoy F, Heald Bank, Tabs Buoy B,
Galveston 424, Galveston 221, High Island A109, Galveston 282, High
Island 157, High Island A131, High Island 63, High Island A179, High
Island A410, Brazos A4, Galveston A196, High Island A23, Galveston
A250, Galveston 317 and Galveston A171.

This warning also includes the following channel lights...

Galveston Bay Entrance Channel Lighted Buoy 3...
Galveston Bay Entrance Channel Lighted Buoy 1...
Galveston Bay Entrance Channel Lighted Buoy 5...
Galveston Bay Entrance Channel Lighted Buoy 1B...
Galveston Bay Entrance Channel Lighted Buoy 1A...
Galveston Bay Entrance Channel Lighted Buoy 6...
Galveston Bay Entrance Channel Lighted Buoy 4...
Galveston Bay Entrance Channel Lighted Buoy 2...
Galveston Bay Entrance Channel Lighted Buoy 2B and
Galveston Bay Entrance Channel Lighted Buoy 2A.

NWSheadline: A SPECIAL MARINE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CST
